info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:37PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Bladen and northeastern Robeson Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near St. Pauls to near Ammon. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, St. Pauls, Howellsville, Tolarsville, Duart, Ammon, Robeson Community College, Tobermory, Ruskin, Barker Ten Mile, White Oak, Jerome and Tar Heel. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 20 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
